discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The error message refers to a classification error.
If the SNMP credentials are incorrect (option B), the discovery attempt would fail completely when connecting to the device, but a classification error would not specifically occur.

Selected Answer: D
From the self-paced learning troubleshooting module on Classification, it says that the classifier for SNMP is missing if you encounter this error

Selected Answer: D
Based on the troubleshooting module of the self-paced training, the example they gave stated that this is the result of a classifier not existing for the specific CI.

Selected Answer: B
B I guess.

Selected Answer: B
I would say B based on this:
https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0535236

Selected Answer: D
From this community thread D is correct, but documentation would be better to be completely sure.
https://www.servicenow.com/community/itom-forum/unable-to-discover-snmp-devices-active-could-t-classify/m-p/931929/page/3

choices.C: SNMP only behavior is not configured.
choices.D: An SNMP Classification must be updated or created for the new device.
choices.A: A firewall blocking the communication between the MID Server and the target device.

questions.question_text: While discovering a new SNMP network device, which choice could cause the error “Active, couldn’t classify” to occur on a Discovery Status?

choices.C: The Linux Server CI Operational Status (operational_status) is set to Non-Operational.
choices.D: The Linux Server CI Status (install_status) is set to Absent.
choices.B: The Disk CI Operational Status (operational_status) is set to Non-Operational.
choices.A: The Disk Status CI (install_status) is set to Absent.

questions.question_text: The deletion strategy is set to ‘Mark as absent’ for related Disk CIs discovered via the Linux Server pattern. If a related Disk CI is discovered during the Linux Server discovery and then the same related Disk CI is not found the next time the Linux Server is discovered, the following will happen:
What would you see in the Discovery pattern log that you would not see in the ECC Queue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

choices.B: Payload of CI attributes and relationships
choices.A: Success or failure of the individual pattern steps

questions.question_text: What do most Discovery properties start with?

discussion.content:
D.
In sys_properties.list filter by name glide.disco and you will get the number

questions.question_text: What is the default thread count for a MID Server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The MID Server default setting for max.threads is 25. If you have made no changes to this setting, your MID Servers will have this value
https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0997594

Selected Answer: D
D - 25 is correct. - 500 (25*Threads)

https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0743566
